qas.question: What did Blair agree to in order to get the support of Rupert Murdoch?

answers.text: not to join the European Exchange Rate Mechanism

qas.question: What happened on BBC's Newsnight in 1998?

answers.text: Peter Mandelson was "outed" by Matthew Parris

qas.question: Who was editor of The Sun in 1998?
What did The Sun say its policy about revealing an individual's sexuality would be moving forward?

answers.text: The Sun would never again reveal a person's sexuality unless it could be defended on the grounds of "overwhelming public interest"

context: In exchange for Rupert Murdoch's support, Blair agreed <a0_0>not to join the European Exchange Rate Mechanism<a0_0/> – which John Major had withdrawn the country from in September 1992 after barely two years. Cabinet Minister <a1_0><a2_0>Peter Mandelson<a1_0/> was "outed" by Matthew Parris<a2_0/> (a former Sun columnist) on BBC TV's Newsnight in November 1998. Misjudging public response, The Sun's editor <a3_0>David Yelland<a3_0/> demanded to know in a front page editorial whether Britain was governed by a "gay mafia" of a "closed world of men with a mutual self-interest". Three days later the paper apologised in another editorial which said <a4_0>The Sun would never again reveal a person's sexuality unless it could be defended on the grounds of "overwhelming public interest"<a4_0/>.
